channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: FAA will reduce air traffic by 10% at many airports to maintain safety
item.description: The Federal Aviation Administration will reduce air traffic at many busy airports to maintain safety during the government shutdown, which has led to staffing shortages of air traffic controllers.
item.content:encoded:
The Federal Aviation Administration will reduce air traffic at many busy airports to maintain safety during the government shutdown, which has led to staffing shortages of air traffic controllers.

(Image credit: Tasos Katopodis)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Rubio, Hegseth brief lawmakers on boat strikes as frustration grows on Capitol Hill
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth briefed top lawmakers on Wednesday on a series of strikes conducted by the Trump administration on alleged drug boats.
item.content:encoded:
Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth briefed top lawmakers on Wednesday on a series of strikes conducted by the Trump administration on alleged drug boats.

(Image credit: Tom Brenner)
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: NYC's next mayor is a democratic socialist. What does that mean?
item.description: Democratic socialism doesn't have a one-size-fits-all definition. But its proponents emphasize a stronger role for the government over the economy to benefit the public.
item.content:encoded:
Democratic socialism doesn't have a one-size-fits-all definition. But its proponents emphasize a stronger role for the government over the economy to benefit the public.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: A declaration of famine is rare. It's now happened twice in 2025, this time in Sudan
item.description: Famine declarations are relatively rare. But the leading international authority on hunger crises this week declared that regions of war-torn Sudan face catastrophic shortages of food.
item.content:encoded:
Famine declarations are relatively rare. But the leading international authority on hunger crises this week declared that regions of war-torn Sudan face catastrophic shortages of food.

(Image credit: Ebrahim Hamid/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Nurith Aizenman

item.title: Judge orders White House to use American Sign Language interpreters at briefings
item.description: The National Association of the Deaf is celebrating a legal victory against the White House. A judge ordered ASL for briefings conducted by the press secretary or President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
The National Association of the Deaf is celebrating a legal victory against the White House. A judge ordered ASL for briefings conducted by the press secretary or President Trump.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: Supreme Court put Trump tariffs on a high-fire grill, in bipartisan scrutiny
item.description: At issue is whether the president can bypass Congress and impose tariffs by citing national security.
item.content:encoded:
At issue is whether the president can bypass Congress and impose tariffs by citing national security.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Why do only some leaves turn red in the fall? Scientists can't agree on an answer
item.description: The red pigments in some fall leaves have proven to be a puzzle for researchers who debate why leaves bother to go red.
item.content:encoded:
The red pigments in some fall leaves have proven to be a puzzle for researchers who debate why leaves bother to go red.

(Image credit: Charlie Riedel)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Democrats' 2025 election wins go beyond big races to places like Georgia, Pennsylvania
item.description: Democrats enjoyed major wins beyond just the marquee races, up and down the ballot — and across the country — continuing the party's momentum heading into the 2026 midterm elections.
item.content:encoded:
Democrats enjoyed major wins beyond just the marquee races, up and down the ballot — and across the country — continuing the party's momentum heading into the 2026 midterm elections.

(Image credit: Frederic J. Brown)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Greetings from Johannesburg, South Africa, where spring bursts with jacaranda blooms
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.content:encoded: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: 5 takeaways from the 2025 elections. And, the shutdown now the longest in U.S. history
item.description: The 2025 elections were good to Democrats with wins in several major races, including governor's races in two states. And, the ongoing government shutdown is now the longest in U.S. history.
item.content:encoded:
The 2025 elections were good to Democrats with wins in several major races, including governor's races in two states. And, the ongoing government shutdown is now the longest in U.S. history.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton
